vehicles.description: Red bus on the right side of the road, moving in the same direction as the ego car
vehicles.explanation: The bus is large and may obstruct the view of the ego car, and if it makes sudden stops to pick up or drop off passengers, the ego car needs to be prepared to slow down or stop.

vehicles.description: Several trucks parked on the right side of the road
vehicles.explanation: These parked trucks reduce the width of the drivable road and may cause other vehicles to merge into the ego car's lane.

traffic signs.description: Bike lane marking on the right edge of the road
traffic signs.explanation: This indicates that cyclists may be present and the ego car should be cautious and give them space.

traffic cones.description: Orange traffic cones placed along the right edge of the road, creating a temporary lane merge
traffic cones.explanation: The cones signal that the ego car needs to merge left and be aware of other vehicles that may also be merging.

barriers.description: Metal guardrail along the right side of the road, with a gap where the trucks are parked
barriers.explanation: The presence of the guardrail limits the space for the ego car to maneuver and requires careful driving to avoid it.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there is a red bus on the right side of the road moving in the same direction as the ego car. This large vehicle may obstruct the view of the ego car, and the ego car needs to be prepared to slow down or stop if the bus makes sudden stops to pick up or drop off passengers. Additionally, several trucks are parked on the right side of the road, reducing the width of the drivable road and potentially causing other vehicles to merge into the ego car's lane.

The road also features a bike lane marking on the right edge, indicating the possible presence of cyclists and the need for the ego car to exercise caution and give them space. Orange traffic cones are placed along the right edge of the road, creating a temporary lane merge which signals to the ego car to merge left and be aware of other vehicles that may be merging as well.

A metal guardrail runs along the right side of the road, with a gap where the trucks are parked. This guardrail limits the space for the ego car to maneuver, necessitating careful driving to avoid it.

1.description and explanation: This object is a red bus navigating the road. It appears to be either stationary or moving slowly, closely aligned to the right lane designated for buses on a multi-lane road. The positioning of the bus next to its designated lane suggests it may have recently made a stop or is preparing to do so. This scenario indicates that the ego car should maintain a safe following distance, monitor the bus's signals for any sudden stops or turns, and be cautious about potential pedestrians around the bus area.

2.description and explanation: This object is a red truck parked by the roadside adjacent to some traffic barriers. The truck is not actively participating in the road traffic but contributes to a potential hazard by restricting the visibility and width of the roadside. This creates a narrowing of the available road space for the ego car, prompting the need for reduced speed and increased alertness to maneuver safely past the parked truck and traffic barriers without incident.

3.description and explanation: This object is a single traffic cone placed on the road. Traffic cones are typically used to signal changes in traffic patterns or to denote areas of caution, possibly due to construction, an accident, or other hazards. The conspicuous placement of this cone on the road requires the ego car to be alert, potentially adjusting its lane position slightly to avoid collision with the cone while keeping an eye out for other related road signs or changes that suggest why the cone is present.

4.description and explanation: This is a set of traffic cones set up on the road. Traffic cones are commonly used to signal areas of the road that are off-limits to vehicles due to construction, accidents, or other roadwork. They serve as a temporary yet impactful means of directing traffic flow and ensuring driver safety by creating a visual barrier that prompts drivers to slow down or change lanes.

driving_suggestion: The ego car should maintain a safe distance from the bus and be prepared to stop or slow down if necessary. It should also carefully navigate the lane merge due to the traffic cones and parked trucks, ensuring to check mirrors and blind spots before merging. The ego car should also be mindful of the potential presence of cyclists in the bike lane.
